comment: His class mostly consists of lectures, but he makes sure to explain concepts well. He is very reachable outside of class, and tries to connect with his students and keep class fun. Participation points are important! There are multiple extra credit opportunities. Grades are mostly test based, so take notes. The reading may be tedious but not hard!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very nice prof. Responds timely to emails. Lots of reading involved and sometimes he posts lectures. Discussions every week and exams are lock down. TA was very helpful in this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: Online Social Problems probably took 5 years off my life with the stress of the papers and the LOTS OF READINGS. I think if it had been a regular semester, it would have been fine, but the short time of the summer semester was killer. Thank God for the TA and her exam review sessions. Ended up being fine in the end, but the road was stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I love Dr.Starks, If you are not lazy it's an easy A. Participate, pass your test, and the project and you should do well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Starks is an awesome professor! He starts with fun surprise activities that connect to the lesson. Readings are important, but lectures really help bring it all together. Participation points matter, and he offers extra credit. I'd definitely take his class again—highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class consist of 150 word discussion post, 250 word written assignments, and module test/quizzes. Lots of reading or listening to podcasts. VERY slow grader, didn't even grade anything until the semester was over which was bad bc nobody knew their grade throughout the semester like what?? He was accessible through email though for questions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Starks was a really kind and caring professor but it was an overload in readings that sometimes when explained in class still didn't make sense. The tests contained essay parts that were graded kinda harshly. He wants the class to be really interactive and attentive. I wouldn't take him again but he wasn't necessarily the worse.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Starks is a really difficult professor to engage with. He's a little awkward but still does his best to make the class engaging and fun, despite it being a pretty mundane subject. He's an insanely slow grader so be ready to have no clue where you stand in his class. He'll tell you to email him if you want a grade which really annoyed me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I took this course fully online and it was pretty easy. I was able to get work done way before the deadline. He takes forever to grade, but the class is very easy. There are things to read for each model but at most it was like a 3 page article, so not much reading and some of the discussion questions are common sense
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: Dr.Starks is a great guy, he is more than willing to help students with anything even things outside of the course like internships or advice. Exams and projects were the main portion of the grade. Exams were inconsistent sadly, and went from note sheet allowed to lockdown by the of the semester. If you make it known you're trying he'll help you :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Starks is a great guy, but the course is ALOT of work. we ended up reading every Wednesday, Thursday, and Fridays and expects you to be prepared before each class, including Mondays. Course schedule is extremely inconsistent and grades late, but will work with you if you show you care at least a little bit about the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor provides a lot of course materials and the discussion posts are lengthy. Also, the quizzes are hit or miss as you should use all course materials for that module in order to pass. Very understanding professor and very helpful when you need him. If you like a lot of work for an online class, he's your guy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Starks is the best professor on the Kennesaw campus. His class is hard but fair meaning he tests on the content he teaches (unlike many other professors). He encourages discussion and posts lectures online after he lectures in class. I still talk to professor Starks to this day. He is an great man.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I ADORE professor Starks. He is just a cool professor to have. You can tell he is passionate about his subjects, loves discussing them and hearing other's outlooks. I will say, there are a lot of LONG readings and pop quizzes on them, but quizzes aren't worth much. Each test has a good review before that helps tremendously.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment: While professor starks class presents a good challenge he is my favorite professor I've ever had. He's fun yet smart and respects all his students even when they don't respect him. He's a classy guy. You truly learn a sociological view of religion when you take this class. I love professor starks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Tips from an A student: You must be prepared to READ and APPLY. He does not use a textbook, so showing up to class was a must because he can clear up any confusion in the research articles. He provides study guides with possible essay questions, but be prepared to APPLY info on his exams. Passing is possible, but you have to work for it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Starks is one of my favorite professors that I have had during college. He made learning and understanding this subject much more enjoyable than I expected. Participation does count as a grade, but the environment he creates makes it so easy to do so. Take Dr. Starks if you need a sociology class, you won't regret it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: This is my second time taking Dr. Starks and he was even better this time around. Despite COVID, he managed to keep our class organized enough to get through all of our material and he did much better than other professors that I've had throughout the pandemic. His class can be a little difficult so you must stay focused and study hard to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: He is so nice, never read the book just show up for the lectures. He really cares and if you ask he will push test back for more time. Two easy papers, four test. Test do have writing portions so be aware of that. Overall he is very nice and caring about his students. Please actually show up for your class, he gets sad when no one does.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Really fair. Do the work and he will see your effort
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: please don't take this class unless you want to learn ONLY about catholicism. we had 2-3 readings a week, every week of the semester and out of all of that, only 2 brushed on other religions. i've never been so disappointed with a class. he ONLY teaches and talks about catholicism bc he is a catholic, so his bias pours in too much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Starks and his Sociology class are both very great choices if you ever get the chance to take them! Professor Starks loves what he teaches and he puts his all into his classes and his students. For our Sociology class, there were 4 tests and a few extra credit assignments that he offered. I wouldn't say his class was easy, but he helps us
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Starks taught in an interesting manner, throwing in group projects here and there when he could. He had some issues with grading and timing of grades, but the content was fair. Expectations for reading were high and exam questions were moderate in difficulty, and for once I had to study a bit. Fair, fun class with some obstacles.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Friendly and personable, interesting lectures, uses kahoots for attendance tracking and the kahoot questions are ALWAYS on the exam. If you don't like to read I wouldn't recommend him, he uses articles and two books by sociologists as the textbook and puts questions from them on the exam. Really engages the class in discussions, gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Soooo much reading. I could rarely finish all the readings before each class. The lectures didnt relate to the readings and none of the lectures flowed together, so the material was all choppy and hard to understand. I had to put in a lot of extra effort to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! So. much. reading. like hours worth every single night. Every single one of his lectures do not follow the next day's one so I was lost 99% of the time. He also does a poor job with students with disabilities. There was one girl in the class that actually moved classes bc he didn't accommodate like he should've.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Such a sweet guy, he really cares about his students and gives you all the tools and more to excel in this class. Lots and lots of readings, 2 books and many articles but really don't have to read them as long as you study hahah not a hard class at all and he gives you so much extra credit opportunities. Go to class and you will be just fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Dr. Starks is by far the best professor I have ever taken in all 4 years of being at KSU. I have 2 of his classes this semester and I always leave his class with a smile on my face. He really cares about his students and what he teaches, and if you come to class and take notes and do the readings you'll most definitely pass. He is also hilarious !!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Starks is one of the best professors I have ever taken. I've spent the past three semesters taking his classes. His tests aren't easy but if you go to class, read the articles, and DO THE STUDY GUIDES you will do great. He does powerpoint lectures and puts them online. He makes all of his classes interesting and cares a lot. RECOMMEND!!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Starks is my favorite professor I've taken at KSU. He assigns outside reading other than the textbook which makes the classes less dull. You absolutely have to do the reading to pass his tests, but he posts reading guides and if you can answer those questions you'll make an A. He can be a little disorganized sometimes but is very understanding.
Dr. Starks is a great professor! Stay on top of the readings. There is a lot of material to cover-do not fall behind! Great class- highly recommend taking it!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great professor. Taught me so much & genuinely cares about his students. One of the few profs. I would cite as legitimately inspirational. DO YOUR READINGS OR DIE. He definitely makes you earn your grade but also gives you everything you need to get an A. totally accessible & a great person. Definitely take if you get the chance.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: I had him from social problems and sociology of religion. He's awesome! He is the type of professor that wants his students to succeed. Not an easy A, but he will sit down with you and discuss anything you don't understand.  There are 6 quizzes, short answer/fill in the blank, harder then his tests,he gives you a study guide and has review sessions
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: No book for this course and all the readings were online. Dr. Starks is AMAZING. This course was definitely heavy on the reading but it was nothing that was too much to handle. Dr. Starks is very knowledgable on what he teaches and is clear with grading. Tests are multiple choice and short answer. Would highly recommend and definitely take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor starks is one of my favorite professors I've taken at KSU! If you come to class and pay attention, you will do well in the class.  He uses the same questions on tests that he does on quizzes. You have to do the reading every night, but they usually only take 20 minutes or less.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Starks is a great professor. He's available if you need any extra help. To easily pass this class be prepared to complete all the readings and to attend class, if you do all those things you'll get an A

Dr Starks is extremely passionate about sociology and social justice. He shows in his lectures a very dynamic understanding of the material and will really make you engage in this way. He wants you to really understand what the reasons are about. Tough but positive and helpful if you are present and engaged.

Dr. Starks is awesome! If you come to class, do the readings, take advantage of the extra credit, and complete the study guides you will make a good grade. He is passionate about sociology and it shows. He makes class fun and I would definitely take him again! My favorite professor in the department so far.

Hands down one of my favorite teachers! I  wouldn't say that there is an unreasonable amount of outside reading (about 30 mins per class). There are quizzes but if you look at the reading questions before hand you'll be fine. The test are pretty straight forward just go through the study guide. HE IS BEYOND HELPFUL, just ask. best lectures. show up

Dr. Starks is by far my least favorite professor I have taken at KSU. He is extremely unhelpful and has unreasonable expectations of students. The readings he assigns are fairly lengthy, and are worded in such a way that one not familiar with religious sociology will find extremely difficult to understand. He also assigns a lot of his own writings.
Overall He is really tough! However he is just very intelligent. He likes to help you just have to ask for it. However be ready to read, and take quizzes.

Was often the cause of frustration because of confusing assignments with no rubric.  A few last minute reading assignments (less than 24-hours notice.)  Even though classes were on TuesdayThursday, assignments due on Saturday, which effectively made it a 3-day class instead of a 2-day.  Would not take a course with him again.
